get.description: Returns a list of calendars with the events for the current user in the selected period.
Returns a calendar with the events for the current user in the selected period.

Returns a list of all the subscriptions available to the current user.

**Note**: Please note that the list of events in the response will be empty.

Returns the detailed information about a calendar with the ID specified in the request.

**Note**: Please note that the list of events in the response will be empty.

put.description:
Updates the selected calendar with the parameters (name, description, color, etc.) specified in the request.

**Note**: Please note that the list of events in the response will be empty.

delete.description: Deletes a calendar with the ID specified in the request.

put.description:
Updates the calendar display parameters specified in the request for the current user.

**Note**: Please note that the list of events in the response will be empty.

get.description: Returns a link to the iCal related to the calendar with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a link to the CalDav related to the calendar with the ID specified in the request.

Returns the iCal feed associated with the calendar by its ID and signagure specified in the request.

**Note**: To get the feed, you need to use the method returning the iCal feed link (it will generate the necessary signature).

post.summary: Import the iCal events to the default calendar
post.description: Imports the events from the iCal files to the default calendar.

post.summary: Import the iCal events to the specified calendar
post.description: Imports the events from the iCal files to the calendar with the ID specified in the request.

post.summary: Import the events from the iCal string
post.description: Imports the events from the iCal string to the calendar with the ID specified in the request.

post.summary: Create a calendar by the iCal link
post.description:
Creates a calendar by the link to the external iCal feed.

**Note**: Please note that the list of events in the response will be empty.

post.description: Creates a new event in the default calendar with the parameters specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the existing event in the selected calendar with the parameters specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a task with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a project calendar with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes the CalDav event from the calendar with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the existing CalDav event in the calendar with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Returns the time offset in the specified time zone compared to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the particular dates.
Creates a new iCal event in the selected calendar with the parameters specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the existing iCal event in the selected calendar with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes the event series from the calendar.

delete.summary: Delete the specified event(s) from event series
delete.description: Deletes the specified event(s) from the series of repeating events.

get.description: Returns the iCal event by its UID from the history.

get.summary: Get the iCal event by ID
get.description: Returns the iCal event by its ID from the history.

Returns the default values for the sharing access parameters.

post.description:
Adds a comment to the post with the ID specified in the request. The parent comment ID can be also specified if needed.

**Note**: Send parentId=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 or don't send it at all if you want your comment to be on the root level.

post.summary: Upload a file to the "My documents" section
post.description:
Uploads a file specified in the request to the "My documents" section by single file uploading or standart multipart/form-data method. **Note**: You can upload files in two different ways:
  1. Using single file upload. You should set the Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers to specify a file name and content type, and send the file to the request body.
  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.

post.summary: Upload a file to the "Common" section
post.description:
Uploads a file specified in the request to the "Common" section by single file uploading or standart multipart/form-data method. **Note**: You can upload files in two different ways:
  1. Using single file upload. You should set the Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers to specify a file name and content type, and send the file to the request body.
  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.

Uploads a file specified in the request to the selected folder by single file uploading or standart multipart/form-data method. **Note**: You can upload files in two different ways:
  1. Using single file upload. You should set the Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers to specify a file name and content type, and send the file to the request body.
  2. Using standart multipart/form-data method.

post.summary: Insert a file to the "My documents" section
post.description: Inserts a file specified in the request to the "My documents" section by single file uploading.

post.summary: Insert a file to the "Common" section
post.description: Inserts a file specified in the request to the "Common" section by single file uploading.
Inserts a file specified in the request to the selected folder by single file uploading.

put.description: Updates the content of a file with the ID specified in the request.
Saves edits to a file with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Informs about opening a file with the ID specified in the request for editing, locking it from being deleted or moved (this method is called by the mobile editors).

get.description: Tracks file changes when editing.
Returns the initialization configuration of a file to open it in the editor.

post.description: Creates a session to upload large files in multiple chunks to the folder with the ID specified in the request. **Note**: Each chunk can have different length but the length should be multiple of 512 and greater or equal to 10 mb. Last chunk can have any size. After the initial response to the request with the 200 OK status, you must get the location field value from the response. Send all your chunks to this location. Each chunk must be sent in the exact order the chunks appear in the file. After receiving each chunk, the server will respond with the current information about the upload session if no errors occurred. When the number of bytes uploaded is equal to the number of bytes you sent in the initial request, the server responds with the 201 Created status and sends you information about the uploaded file.
Creates a new folder with the title specified in the request. The parent folder ID can be also specified.

put.description: Renames the selected folder with a new title specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the detailed information about a folder with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a folder with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Creates a new folder structure specified in the request in a folder with a specific ID.

post.summary: Create a file in the "My documents" section
post.description:
Creates a new file in the "My documents" section with the title specified in the request.

**Note**: If a file extension is different from DOCX/XLSX/PPTX and refers to one of the known text, spreadsheet or presentation formats, it will be changed to DOCX/XLSX/PPTX accordingly. If the file extension is not specified or is unknown, the DOCX extension will be added to the file title.

Creates a new file in the specified folder with the title specified in the request.

**Note**: If a file extension is different from DOCX/XLSX/PPTX and refers to one of the known text, spreadsheet or presentation formats, it will be changed to DOCX/XLSX/PPTX accordingly. If the file extension is not specified or is unknown, the DOCX extension will be added to the file title.

get.description: Returns the detailed information about the shared file with the ID specified in the request.

put.description:
Sets the sharing settings to a file with the ID specified in the request.

**Note**: Each of the sharing parameters must contain two values: "ShareTo" - ID of the user with whom we want to share a file, "Access" - access type which we want to give to the user (Read, ReadWrite, etc).

get.description: Returns the detailed information about the shared folder with the ID specified in the request.

put.description:
Sets the sharing settings to a folder with the ID specified in the request.

**Note**: Each of the sharing parameters must contain two values: "ShareTo" - ID of the user with whom we want to share a folder, "Access" - access type which we want to give to the user (Read, ReadWrite, etc).

put.description: Returns an external link to the shared file with the ID specified in the request.

post.summary: Set a cookie for a password-protected external link
post.description: Sets a cookie after verifying the password for a password-protected external link and returns a link to the shared file.

post.summary: Get a token for a password-protected external link
post.description:
Returns a token after verifying the password or password hash for a password-protected external link.

**Note**: The token is used in the cookies with the 'sharelink[linkId]' name when calling API methods.

get.description:
Returns a list of the available providers.

post.description:
Saves the third-party storage service account. For WebDav, Yandex, kDrive and SharePoint, the login and password are used for authentication. For other providers, the authentication is performed using a token received via OAuth 2.0.

**Note**: List of provider keys: DropboxV2, Box, WebDav, Yandex, OneDrive, SharePoint, GoogleDrive, kDrive.

delete.description: Deletes a task status with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list with the detailed information about all the messages matching the filter parameters specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the discussion messages within a project with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Adds a message to the selected discussion within a project with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the selected discussion message from a project with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a message with the ID specified in the request from a project discussion.

get.description: Returns the detailed information about a discussion message with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the selected message status.

get.description: Returns the detailed information about files attached to the discussion message with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Uploads files specified in the request to the selected discussion message.

delete.summary: Detach a file from a message
delete.description: Detaches the selected file from the discussion message with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list of the recent discussion messages from a project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a list of the discussion message comments from a project with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Adds a comment to the selected discussion message with the text specified in the request. The parent comment ID can be also selected.

put.description: Subscribes to the notifications about the actions performed in the discussion with the selected message.

get.description: Checks subscription to the notifications about the actions performed in the discussion with the selected message.
Returns a list of all the subscribers to the discussion with the selected message.

post.description: Returns a preview of the discussion message.
Checks the report data by the URI specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a report status.
Terminates the reporting process.

post.description: Creates a project report template with the parameters specified in the request. Most of the parameters are optional and depend on the report type selected.

put.description: Updates the selected project report template with the parameters specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a project report template with the ID specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a project report template with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the generated report files.

delete.description: Removes the generated report file with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list of all the projects which the current user is following.
Returns a list of all the projects with a status specified in the request.
Returns the detailed information about a project with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the existing project using all the parameters (project ID, title, description, responsible ID, etc) specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a project with the ID specified in the request from the portal.

get.description: Returns the search results for a project containing the words/phrases matching the query specified in the request.

post.summary: Create a project with team security
post.description: Creates a new project with team security using all the necessary (title, description, responsible ID, etc) and some optional parameters specified in the request.

put.summary: Update a project with team security
put.description: Updates the existing project with team security using all the parameters (project ID, title, description, responsible ID, etc) specified in the request.
Updates a status of a project with the ID specified in the request.
Subscribes to or unsubscribes from the notifications about the actions performed in the project with the ID specified in the request.
Updates a tag from the selected project with a new tag specified in the request.
Updates the tags from the selected project with the new tags specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the detailed information about the time spent on the project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns the total time spent on the project with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Adds a new milestone using the parameters (project ID, milestone title, deadline, etc) specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list of all the milestones from a project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the milestones with the selected status from a project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the users participating in the project with the ID specified in the request.

post.summary: Add a user to the team
post.description: Adds a user with the ID specified in the request to the selected project team.

delete.summary: Remove a user from the team
delete.description: Removes a user with the ID specified in the request from the selected project team.

put.description: Updates a project team with the user IDs specified in the request.

get.summary: Get current and excluded team members
get.description: Returns a list of all the current and excluded project team members.

post.description: Returns a list of all the users participating in the projects with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Sets the security rights to the user with the ID specified in the request from the selected project.

get.description: Returns a list of all the tasks from a project with the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Adds a task to the selected project with the parameters (responsible user ID, task description, deadline time, etc) specified in the request.

post.summary: Add a task by message ID
post.description: Adds a task to the selected project by the message ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list of all the tasks with the selected status in the project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the tasks for the current user with the selected status in the project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns the detailed list of all the files and folders for the project with the ID specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the files for the entity with the type and ID specified in the request.
Returns all the latest user login activity including successful logins and failed attempts with an indication of reasons.
Returns a list of the latest changes (creation, modification, deletion, etc.) made by users to the entities (tasks, opportunities, files, etc.) on the portal.
Returns a list of the login events by the parameters specified in the request.
Returns a list of the audit events by the parameters specified in the request.
Returns all the available audit trail types.
Returns the mappers for the audit trail types.

post.description: Generates the login history report.
Generates the audit trail report.

get.description: Returns the audit trail settings.

post.description: Sets the audit trail settings for the current portal.

get.description: Returns all the active connections to the portal.

put.description: Logs out from all the active connections for the current user and changes their password.

put.summary: Log out for the user by ID
put.description: Logs out from all the active connections for the user with the ID specified in the request.
Logs out from all the active connections except the current connection.
Logs out from the connection with the ID specified in the request.
Updates the login settings with the parameters specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the impersonation settings for the current portal.

put.description: Uppdates the impersonation settings with the parameters specified in the request.

get.description: Checks if a user with the ID specified in the request can be impersonated or not.

post.description: Impersonates a user with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Log out from the account of the impersonated user.
Updates the IP restriction settings with a parameter specified in the request.
Updates the tip settings with a parameter specified in the request.
Updates the tip subscription.
Updates the two-factor authentication settings with the type specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the current two-factor authentication settings.

put.description: Requests the new backup codes for the two-factor authentication application.
Unlinks the current two-factor authentication application from the user account specified in the request.

post.summary: Saves the Documents Firebase device token
post.description: Saves the Firebase device token specified in the request for the Documents application.

post.summary: Saves the Projects Firebase device token
post.description: Saves the Firebase device token specified in the request for the Projects application.

get.description: Checks if the current user is connected to the Telegram Bot or not.

delete.description: Unlinks the Telegram Bot from your account.

put.description: Closes the welcome pop-up notification.
Closes the admin helper notification.

get.description: Returns a list of the custom navigation items.

get.summary: Get a custom navigation item sample
get.description: Returns a custom navigation item sample.

get.summary: Get a custom navigation item by ID
get.description: Returns a custom navigation item by the ID specified in the request.

post.description: Adds a custom navigation item with the parameters specified in the request.

delete.description: Deletes a custom navigation item with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Updates the email activation settings.

get.description: Returns the space usage statistics of the module with the ID specified in the request.
Returns the user visit statistics for the period specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the portal storages.

put.description: Updates a storage with the parameters specified in the request.

delete.description: Resets the storage settings to the default parameters.

get.description: Returns the storage progress.
Returns a list of all the CDN storages.

put.description: Updates the CDN storage with the parameters specified in the request.

delete.description: Resets the CDN storage settings to the default parameters.

get.description: Returns a list of all the backup storages.
Returns a list of all Amazon regions.
Returns the socket settings.
Returns the current portal SMTP settings.

post.description: Saves the SMTP settings for the current portal.

delete.description: Resets SMTP settings of the current portal.

get.description: Tests the SMTP settings for the current portal (send test message to the user email).

get.summary: Get the SMTP test process status
get.description: Returns the SMTP test process status.
Returns the current portal SSO settings.

post.description: Saves the SSO settings for the current portal.

delete.description: Resets the SSO settings of the current portal.

get.description: Returns the default portal SSO settings.
Returns the SSO settings constants.
Returns the current portal LDAP settings.

post.description: Saves the LDAP settings specified in the request and starts importing/synchronizing users and groups by LDAP.

get.description: Returns the LDAP autosynchronous cron expression for the current portal if it exists.

post.description: Sets the LDAP autosynchronous cron expression to the current portal.

get.description: Synchronizes the portal data with the new information from the LDAP server.
Starts the process of collecting preliminary changes on the portal during the synchronization process according to the selected LDAP settings.

post.description: Starts the process of saving LDAP settings and collecting preliminary changes on the portal according to them.

get.summary: Get the LDAP synchronization process status
get.description: Returns the LDAP synchronization process status.
Returns the LDAP default settings.

post.description: Save user quota limit

put.description: Set tenant quota settings

get.description: Starts the process of recalculating quota.
Checks the process of recalculating quota.

put.description: Changes a quota limit for the users with the IDs specified in the request.

get.description: Starts the process of recalculating users quota.
Checks the process of recalculating users quota.
Returns the security settings for the modules specified in the request.

put.description: Sets the security settings to the module with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the availability of the module with the ID specified in the request.
Returns the portal password settings.

put.description: Sets the portal password settings.

put.summary: Set the security settings to modules
put.description: Sets the security settings to the modules with the IDs specified in the request.

get.description: Returns a list of all the administrators of the product with the ID specified in the request.
Checks if the selected user is an administrator of a product with the ID specified in the request.

put.description: Sets the selected user as an administrator of a product with the ID specified in the request.

get.description: Returns the portal logo image URL.
Returns the IP portal restrictions.

put.description: Saves the new portal IP restrictions specified in the request.
